speaker: Sarah
text: Hey, Duncan, want to join me for a swim?

speaker: Duncan
text: Oh, um, thanks for the offer, Sarah, but I think I'll stay here for now.

speaker: Sarah
text: Oh, come on. It'll be so much fun. Just you and me, enjoying the water.

speaker: Duncan
text: I-I appreciate the invitation, but it's probably best if I pass.

speaker: Sarah
text: You know, I find you really attractive.

speaker: Duncan
text: Sarah, you're a great friend, but I care about my sister Mary, and I don't want to cross any boundaries.

speaker: Sarah
text: Can't we just have some harmless fun?

speaker: Duncan
text: I'm sorry, but I can't do that. Our friendship is important to me, and I don't want to risk ruining it.

speaker: Sarah
text: You're always so serious, Duncan!

speaker: Duncan
text: It's not about being serious. It's about being respectful and caring about the people we're close to.

speaker: Sarah
text: I didn't think about that.

speaker: Duncan
text: Just be mindful of your actions, Sarah. Our friendship means a lot to me, and I want to protect it.

speaker: Sarah
text: I didn't mean to cause any problems.

speaker: Duncan
text: I know, and I appreciate your friendship too.

speaker: Sarah
text: Fine, whatever.

speaker: Duncan
text: Let's still have a great time together, as friends.

speaker: Anna
text: Hey, sis, what's on your mind?

speaker: Mary
text: I don't know, Anna. I've noticed something about Sarah's behavior, and it's kind of bothering me.

speaker: Anna
text: Oh? What's going on?

speaker: Mary
text: It's just that she's been acting a bit too flirty with the guys, especially with Duncan. It's making me uncomfortable.

speaker: Anna
text: I can understand why that would bother you. Have you thought about talking to her about it?

speaker: Mary
text: I don't want to start a big argument or cause drama.

speaker: Anna
text: I get that, but sometimes, it's better to address these things than to let them fester. You and Sarah are close friends, right?

speaker: Mary
text: Yeah, we are.

speaker: Anna
text: Then maybe it's worth having an honest conversation with her. It doesn't have to be confrontational; just let her know how you feel.

speaker: Mary
text: That's a good point, Anna. I'll think about how to talk to her.

speaker: Anna
text: That's my girl. Always thoughtful and kind.

speaker: Mary
text: Thanks, Anna. I appreciate you.

speaker: Anna
text: Anytime, sis. I'm here for you.

speaker: Sarah
text: Hey, Mary, you've been quiet. Anything on your mind?

speaker: Mary
text: Well, Sarah, there is something I've been meaning to discuss with you.

speaker: Sarah
text: Oh? What's up?

speaker: Mary
text: I've noticed some things about your behavior that are making me, and possibly others, a bit uncomfortable.

speaker: Sarah
text: What? I don't understand. What have I done?

speaker: Mary
text: I think you might be a little too flirty with some of the guys, especially Duncan. I know you probably don't mean any harm, but it's something I thought you should be aware of.

speaker: Sarah
text: I... I didn't realize. I was just trying to have fun. I'm sorry if I made anyone uncomfortable.

speaker: Mary
text: It's okay, Sarah. We all make mistakes. The important thing is that we learn from them.

speaker: Sarah
text: Thanks for telling me, Mary. I appreciate your honesty.

speaker: Mary
text: Of course, Sarah. We're friends, and that's what friends do.
